title: Lecture 1 – Introduction:
text:
1 Introduction

Theorem 1 (Line) Let \(f\) be a continuous function on \([a, b]\). Then \(f\) is bounded on \([a, b]\).


Proof. By induction.

title: Lecture 1 – Introduction:
text:
2 What is Supervised Learning?
We are given training data \(\{(x_i, y_i)\}_{i=1}^n\)…

2.1 Hypothesis Class
We define a hypothesis class \(\mathcal{H}\) such that…
\[
h^* = \arg\min_{h \in \mathcal{H}} \mathcal{R}(h)
\]

title: Lecture 1 – Introduction:
text:
3 Goals
By the end of this lecture, you should understand: - What supervised learning is - The difference between training loss and true risk
